intro: Caucasalia pontica, commonly known as the Pontic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
